cs351.project2

Class GamePopulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs351.project2.GamePopulation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Population

    public class GamePopulation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Population
    GamePopulation is called by EvolutionLoop. This class is used to manage the tribes, which in turn manages objects that fall within its hierarchy.

      • generateStartingState

        public void generateStartingState(EvolutionEngine engine,
                                  int numTribes)
        This function should clear the existing tribe and reinitialize it to some starting state. Along with this, a fitness function should be generated in order to be used not only by this class, but by all other classes that want to create genomes.
        Specified by:
        generateStartingState in interface Population
        Parameters:
        engine - engine object for callbacks
        numTribes - number of tribes to initialize

      • validatePopulationData

        public void validatePopulationData()
                            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This should only ever be called by an evolution engine. The purpose is to allow the population to make sure that the Tribe it maintains does not contain genomes that the population doesn't know about. This will only happen is another part of the simulation directly added to the population's tribe without running it through the population first.

        The reason this is important is because the population won't be able to assign mutator objects to genomes it doesn't know about.

        Specified by:
        validatePopulationData in interface Population
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - thrown if the Tribe and population have fallen out of sync
